title: EastEnders' Katie Jarvis 'gets a real job' in providing for family shocker
text:
The actress appeared on Albert Square earlier this year (Picture: BBC)

Ex-EastEnders star Katie Jarvis has landed herself a new role as a security guard at a B&M instead of becoming a starving artist cliché.

Shocking.

The 28-year-old actress has opted to provide for her two children Lillie May, 10, and eight-year-old Alfie, rather than fight her way through an uncertain and difficult industry.

Spotted at her new workplace, Katie confirmed that she was securing a steady paycheque while she’s in between roles.

‘I’ve taken a step back from acting. I’ve got a job and I’m looking after my kids,’ she told Daily Star Sunday.

Fair play to her, to be honest. God forbid someone actually earn a living or even wanting to try a new direction in life.

Katie’s best known for playing Hayley Slater in EastEnders – who wreaked havoc across Albert Square after having a one-night stand with her cousin Kat’s (Jessie Wallace) husband Alfie Moon (Shane Richie) in 2018.

Advertisement

Advertisement

Things got complicated when she had a baby girl, Cherry, with Alfie, and Kat discovered the truth on Christmas day for an explosive festive episode.

Her character later ran away from a mental health facility in February, leaving an open possibility for return as fans thought she may make a reappearance in the future.

Katie’s complicated character Hayley was last seen fleeing from a mental health facility (Picture: BBC)

But since then the actress has not taken on any new roles.

And if she wants to give up acting all together, more power to her. Good on her for putting her family first.

description: Katie Jarvis played Hayley Slater for a year on Eastenders but is now working as a security guard in Romford.
